article.name: Update Training Progress Manually
article.title: Update Training Progress Manually
label_names: pass a user on a training module
article.body:
When necessary, you have the ability to manually update the progress of your users enrolled in active training campaigns. There are three options for updating training progress:

  • You can Pass one or more users, meaning their status for the training assignment or training campaign will be changed to Completed.
  • You can Reset Progress for one or more users, meaning their progress for the training assignment or training campaign will be erased. Their training status will show as Not Started.
  • You can Remove a user from a training campaign, but not from an individual piece of content. Once removed, the user will no longer be enrolled in any of the courses within that campaign.
    Important:Removing a user from a training campaign deletes any record of the user being enrolled in the campaign. The user's enrollment will not be included in any reports.

Each of these options can be used for one or more users by manually selecting users in the console or by uploading a CSV file for a bulk update.

Manually Select Users to Pass

To manually Pass one or more users, follow the steps below.

  1. In your KnowBe4 console, click on the Training tab and then click the Campaigns subtab.
  2. From the Active campaign list, select the campaign you would like to update the progress for. The campaign overview page will open.
  3. To update user progress for the entire campaign, click on the Users tab.
    Note:To update user progress for a single course, find the course from the list on the Overview tab. Then, click the User Progress button beneath the course name.
  4. A list of all enrolled users will display.
  5. Click the check boxes next to the users you would like to pass. You can also use the top check box to select all users shown on the page.
    Note:You can update up to 50 users at a time. Each page shows 25 users by default.
  6. Once you have selected all the users you wish to pass, click the Actions drop-down button in the top-right. Then, select Mark as Completed.
  7. A confirmation message will display. Click Confirm to pass the selected users and change their training status to Completed.

Manually Select Users to Reset Progress

To manually Reset Progress for one or more users, follow the steps below.

  1. In your KnowBe4 console, click on the Training tab and then click the Campaigns subtab.
  2. From the Active campaign list, select the campaign you would like to update progress for and the campaign overview page will open.
  3. To update user progress for the entire campaign, click on the Users tab.
    Note: To update user progress for a single course, find the course from the list on the Overview tab. Then, click the User Progress button beneath the course name.
  4. A list of all enrolled users will display.
  5. Click the check box next to the users you would like to reset progress for. You can also use the top check box to select all users shown on the page.
    Note:You can update up to 50 users at a time. Each page shows 25 users by default.
  6. Click the Actions drop-down button in the top-right corner of the page, then select Reset Progress.
  7. A confirmation message will display. Click Confirm to reset the progress of the selected users and change their training status to Not Started.

Manually Remove a User From a Campaign

Users can be manually removed one at a time. If you want to remove more than one user at a time, we recommend using the Bulk Update option. To remove a single user from a campaign, follow the steps below.

Important: Removing a user from a training campaign deletes any record of the user being enrolled in the campaign. The user's enrollment will not be included in any reports.
  1. In your KnowBe4 console, go to Training > Campaigns.
  2. From the campaign list, click the name of the campaign that the user is enrolled in.
  3. From the campaign overview page, click the Users subtab. The page that opens lists all users currently enrolled in the campaign.
  4. Click the check boxes next to the users you would like to remove.
  5. Click the Actions drop-down button in the top-right corner of the page, then select Remove Users.
  6. In the confirmation message that displays, click Confirm to remove the user from this campaign.

Bulk Update Progress

The Bulk Update option allows you to pass, reset progress, and remove multiple users all at once. To update the training progress of multiple users in bulk, first prepare a CSV file for upload. The CSV file must use the headers Email and Update-Progress.

When updating progress for the entire training campaign, use any of the following options in the Update-Progress column: Pass-All, Reset-All, or Remove-All.

Important:Removing a user from a training campaign deletes any record of the user being enrolled in the campaign. The user's enrollment will not be included in any reports.

See the example below:

Email Update-Progress
User1@example.com Pass-All
User2@example.com Reset-All
User3@example.com Remove-All

When updating progress for a single training course, use either of the following options in the Update-Progress column: Pass-Course or Reset-Course. See the example below:

Email Update-Progress
User1@example.com Pass-Course
User2@example.com Pass-Course
User3@example.com Reset-Course

Once your CSV file is ready for upload, follow the steps below.

  1. In your KnowBe4 console, click on the Training tab and then click the Campaigns subtab.
  2. From the Active campaign list, select the campaign you would like to update progress for and the campaign overview page will open.
  3. To update user progress for the entire campaign, click on the Users tab.
    Note:To update user progress for a single course, find the course from the list on the Overview tab. Then, click the User Progress button beneath the course name.
  4. A list of all enrolled users will display.
  5. At the top of the page, click the Bulk Update link. The following modal will open:
  6. Click the Browse button and select the CSV file you created.
  7. You can choose who will be notified of this update by selecting from the options None, All Console Admins, or Specific Admins.
    • The selected admins will receive an email notification that lists the number of successful updates along with any errors that occurred.
  8. When you're ready, click the Bulk Update button at the bottom of the page.
Important:Once you click Bulk Update this action cannot be undone.

images.alt:
This image depicts the **Users** tracking and reporting interface within a learning or compliance management system.

**Navigation and Metrics:**
The top navigation indicates the user is currently viewing the **Users** tab (active) rather than the **Overview** tab. Directly below, a dashboard element summarizes the status of the enrolled population across six categories, with the **All Users** count (538) currently selected.

| Status | Percentage | Count | Color Indication |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| All Users | N/A | 538 | Dark Gray (Selected) |
| Incomplete | 44.6% | 240 | Teal |
| Not Started | 44.6% | 240 | Teal |
| In Progress | 0% | 0 | Red |
| Completed | 55.4% | 298 | Green |
| Past Due | 0% | 0 | Red |

**Control and Action Bar:**
The interface includes filtering and bulk action controls:
1.  **Search Bar:** Input field with placeholder text "Search for users by name or email."
2.  **Toggle Switch:** Labeled "Include Archived Users."
3.  **Bulk Actions:** A set of blue and green buttons:
    *   **Bulk Update** (Link with refresh icon)
    *   **Generate CSV** (Green button with download icon)
    *   **Enroll Users** (Blue button with user/plus icon)
    *   **Actions** (Blue dropdown button with gear icon)

**Data Table Structure:**
The main content is a detailed data table listing user enrollments, with column headers: Checkbox (for multi-selection), **Content Name**, **Enrollment Date**, **Time Spent**, **Time Remaining**, **Score**, and **Status**.

**Sample Data Rows:**
The table is organized by individual user headers (e.g., **Aaron Anderson**, **Addie Powlowski**), each linked to communication options (envelope icon). The assigned content is displayed beneath the user name:
*   **Entry 1 (Aaron Anderson):** Assigned "Security Culture Survey (SCS)," Enrolled 11/12/2022, Time Spent 00:00, Time Remaining 8 days. **Status:** Not Started (gray badge).
*   **Entry 2 (Addie Powlowski):** Assigned "Security Culture Survey (SCS)," Enrolled 11/12/2022, Time Spent 20:00, Time Remaining 8 days. **Status:** Completed (green badge).

images.alt:
This image displays a data table within a User Interface (UI), likely for an administrative or reporting dashboard concerning user training or assessment tracking.

**UI Elements and Functionality:**

1.  **Search Bar:** Located at the top, a search input field is present with the placeholder text: "Search for users by name or email," accompanied by a magnifying glass icon for execution.
2.  **Action Buttons:** Three primary actions are available on the top right:
    *   **Bulk Update:** Text link with a refresh icon.
    *   **Download CSV:** Green button with a download icon.
    *   **Actions:** Blue button with a gear icon and a dropdown caret.

**Data Table Structure (Columns):**

The table tracks performance across multiple categories for enrolled users:

| Column Name | Data Type/Purpose |
| :--- | :--- |
| Checkbox | UI element for row selection (to enable bulk actions). |
| **Content Name** | Lists user names (bolded headers, e.g., "Aaron Anderson") and associated training materials. |
| **Enrollment Date** | Date of user enrollment (MM/DD/YYYY format). |
| **Content Started** | Indicates if content has been accessed (checkmark for yes, blank for no). |
| **Time Spent** | Duration spent on content (HH:MM format, e.g., 00:00 or 01:03:00). |
| **Time Remaining** | Time left until deadline (e.g., "15 days," "20 days"). |
| **Score** | Percentage score achieved (e.g., "54 %," "83 %," or hyphen if not scored). |
| **Status** | Completion state, displayed as a pill/tag (e.g., "Not Started" in gray/dark red, "Completed" in green). |

**Data Examples (Rows):**

The table is grouped by user, with each user entry containing a list of content items:

*   **User: Aaron Anderson** (Icon indicates user status/type, e.g., external or licensed).
    *   *Content 1 (Assessment Icon):* "Security Awareness Proficiency Assessment." Status: **Not Started**. Enrollment: 02/09/2020.
    *   *Content 2 (Graduation Cap Icon):* "2019 Kevin Mitnick Security Awareness Training - 45 Min." Status: **Not Started**. Enrollment: 10/21/2020.
*   **User: Abraham Nienow** (Icon indicates user status/type).
    *   *Content 1 (Assessment Icon):* "Security Awareness Proficiency Assessment." Status: **Completed**. Score: 54 %. Time Spent: 16:00. Enrollment: 02/09/2020.
    *   *Content 2 (Graduation Cap Icon):* "2019 Kevin Mitnick Security Awareness Training - 45 Min." Status: **Completed** (includes a trophy icon, indicating achievement/certification). Score: 83 %. Time Spent: 01:03:00. Enrollment: 02/09/2020.
images.context: Each page shows 25 users by default.

images.alt:
The image displays a segment of a software interface, primarily focused on an action bar and an associated dropdown menu.

**Action Bar Elements (Left to Right):**
1.  **Bulk Update:** A blue text link accompanied by a refresh icon.
2.  **Download CSV:** A primary green button featuring a download icon (downward arrow).
3.  **Actions:** A blue dropdown button displaying a gear/cog icon and a downward caret.

**Dropdown Menu (Activated State):**
The menu is triggered by the `Actions` button and lists three vertical items:
1.  **Send Notification:** Preceded by an envelope icon.
2.  **Mark as Completed:** Preceded by a user profile icon overlaid with a checkmark. This specific menu item is highlighted by a thick orange rectangular border, indicating selection or emphasis.
3.  **Reset Progress:** Preceded by a curved arrow/reset icon.

**Context:**
Beneath the action bar, partially visible column headers suggest an underlying data table structure, including headings such as `Time Remaining` and `Score`.

images.alt:
This image captures a segment of an administrative user interface (UI), focusing on bulk action controls and a resulting dropdown menu.

**UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Action Buttons/Links (Top Row):** A series of bulk controls is visible, including a link for **Bulk Update** and three primary buttons: **Generate CSV** (green, with download icon), **Enroll Users** (blue, with person icon), and **Actions** (blue, with gear icon and dropdown arrow).
2.  **Table Headers (Bottom Context):** Partially visible below the controls is a table header row, including the column titles **Time Spent**, **Time Remaining**, and **Score**.
3.  **Actions Dropdown Menu:** The **Actions** button has been activated, displaying a dropdown menu with the following management options (top-down):
    *   Send Notification (Icon: Envelope)
    *   Mark as Completed (Icon: Person with checkmark)
    *   Reset Progress (Icon: Circular refresh/undo arrow)
    *   Remove Users (Icon: Person with 'x')

**Focus Element:**

The menu option **Reset Progress** is the focus of the image, highlighted by a thick, orange rectangular border. This action, accompanied by a refresh icon, allows users to revert the progress status of selected accounts or data entries.

images.alt:
This technical description details a modal dialog designed for mass updating user training progress via CSV import.

**Title and Context:**
The interface is titled **"Bulk Update Training Progress"** and includes a standard close button (X) in the upper right corner.

**File Selection (Mandatory Input):**
1.  **Label:** `Select a CSV File`
2.  **Input Field:** A file upload input currently displaying **`No file chosen`**.
3.  **Action Button:** `Browse` (initiates file system navigation).

**Notification Settings (Segmented Control):**
The prompt **`Once completed, send notification to:`** is followed by a segmented control element defining the recipient for job completion messages.
*   **Options:** `None` (currently selected/highlighted), `All Console Admins`, `Specific Admins`.

**Informational Panels:**

1.  **Format Guidance (Teal Panel):** Provides required CSV structure.
    *   **Instruction:** `Your CSV file should have the following format:`
    *   **Header Example:** `Email, Update-Progress`
    *   **Data Examples:** Illustrates recognized update commands (`Pass-All`, `Reset-All`, `Remove-All`) applied to sample user emails (`test1@...`, `test2@...`, `test3@...`).

2.  **Warning Note (Red Panel):** Highlights the permanence of the action.
    *   **Content:** `Note: Bulk updating the training progress of users cannot be undone.`

**Action Buttons (Footer):**
The bottom right corner contains two command buttons:
1.  **`Cancel`** (Standard gray action button).
2.  **`Bulk Update`** (Primary action button, highlighted in red, triggering the CSV import process).
